instructions: Launch the Stadia app on a compatible phone or tablet. Hold down the Stadia button on your controller until the controller vibrates, which indicates that it has turned on. Tap the controller icon in the upper right corner of the Stadia app. If prompted, enable location access , Wi-Fi , and Bluetooth . Wait for the app to find your controller, and then select it from the list. Wait for your controller to vibrate, and then tap Yes in the Stadia app. Tap Continue to indicate you have read the microphone privacy statement. Choose whether or not to share diagnostic and usage data. Tap Connect to (your Wi-Fi network name) . Enter your network password, and tap Connect . Wait for your controller to connect. Tap Next when prompted, then tap Done . Your controller is now connected to Wi-Fi and ready to go. You can start setting up your Stadia with your Chromecast immediately if you have your Chromecast connected and can see the on-screen prompts, or continue reading for more specific instructions.

Plug in your Chromecast Ultra, make sure it's powered up, and switch your television to the appropriate HDMI input. Make sure your Chromecast Ultra is connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your Stadia controller. Hold down the Stadia button on your controller until the controller vibrates, indicating that it has turned on. Check your television for a Stadia linking code. Enter the code using your Stadia controller. Return to the Stadia app on your phone or tablet, and tap your avatar in the upper right corner. Select the Chromecast you have just connected your controller to. If prompted, select your Google account that you use with Stadia, and tap Connect . Wait for the process to finish, and tap Done .
